image.altText: A spectacular view of Sydney Harbour shows the Opera House and Harbour Bridge illuminated by golden fireworks.

props.synopsis: Australia's capital cities are set to ring the new year in with a bang. Here's your guide to the celebrations.

title.children: Where to watch New Year's Eve fireworks in Darwin and other cities

image.altText: New Year's Eve revellers in Sydney.

props.synopsis: New Year's Eve celebrations are about to begin throughout Australia, with revellers waiting for fireworks in capital cities while others prepare for parties in the outback.

title.children: NYE revellers wake early to snag best firework vantage points

image.altText: One man puts hand on another sitting down in kitchen

props.synopsis: Kassiou Constructions has been found to have engaged in professional misconduct by the building industry watchdog and received an almost $100,000 fine.

title.children: NT construction company handed record fine for professional misconduct

image.altText: The warm glow of heat lamps shines of green beans, mash potato and other hot dishes in a bain-marie.

props.synopsis: On a busy day more than 800 fly-in fly-out workers can pass through the dining hall at this mine in the Northern Territory's Tanami Desert, and feeding them is a mammoth task.

title.children: Remote mine's staff eat 16,200 eggs, 3 tonnes of meat a week

image.altText: A patient foot shackled to a medical bed.

props.synopsis: Prisoners transferred to a hospital for palliative care can be shackled to their beds for their final days. Some experts want to see change.

title.children: Calls for end to use of shackles on prisoners in palliative care

image.altText: Early morning soft light on wide stretch of River with trees overhanging the water

props.synopsis: Australia has big ambitions for restoring its degraded environment, but the very regulations meant to protect nature could be thwarting that progress.

title.children: Environmental protection laws are stopping nature from being repaired

image.altText: Portrait of a woman with glasses in front of her painting.

props.synopsis: For some people who survive a traumatic event, processing the pain through art is one way to heal. A group of artists from across Australia who survived Cyclone Tracy are putting this into practice.

title.children: Art therapy helps trauma survivors heal, decades after deadly storm

image.altText: a man and woman carrying photos of a young man inside their home

props.synopsis: After a horror year for road fatalities in the Northern Territory, police and parents speak out about the disturbing reality behind the figures and call for caution on the roads.

title.children: Parents recount 'worst nightmare' after son dies in crash

image.altText: Angelina Jolie wearing a black dress standing next to Brad Pitt in a black suit and tie in front of a black poster backdrop

props.synopsis: The Hollywood actors have come to a settlement agreement after more than eight years of legal negotiations over assets and custody of the couple's six children.

title.children: Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt reach divorce deal after 8-year battle

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios plays a backhand return at the Brisbane International.

props.synopsis: A gallant Nick Kyrgios falls to Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard in three gripping sets, while Novak Djokovic makes a successful start to his singles tilt at the Brisbane International.

title.children: Kyrgios goes down to rising French star, Djokovic wins through in Brisbane

image.altText: Aryna Sabalenka applauds the crowd

props.synopsis: Aryna Sabalenka's aura overcomes early-season rustiness to continue her fine recent record in Australia as a third Australian Open crown looms.

title.children: Sabalenka's aura powers her into second round

image.altText: A young man sitting on the sand at a beach wearing a parka

props.synopsis: NSW Police say search efforts for Hadi Nazari, who has been missing for six days in the Kosciuszko National Park, involves specialist bushwalkers in steep vegetated terrain.

title.children: Searchers airlifted to 'most rugged terrain' in NSW to look for missing bushwalker

image.altText: three people a climbing a sheer rock face on a mountain, holding on to the side

props.synopsis: A Victorian bushwalker in his 30s has died after falling "from height" at Federation Peak, just days after the death of another bushwalker in the same national park.

title.children: Man on trek with partner dies falling 'from height' at Federation Peak

image.altText: A middle-aged woman in a selfie.

props.synopsis: More Australian women come forward with concerns about serious side effects from the popular contraceptive Depo-Provera, with many claiming they were not made aware of the risks of the high-dose hormone.

title.children: 'I sneeze and I break': Health risks from popular contraceptive 'never mentioned', patients say

image.altText: A man raises both hands at a lectern

props.synopsis: A Seoul court approves an arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, who was suspended from parliament earlier this month.

title.children: Arrest warrant issued for South Korean president over martial law

image.altText: A man in a suit walks with two people standing either side of him.

props.synopsis: Scott Rush has faced court in Brisbane after pleading guilty to charges laid in 2005.

title.children: Bali Nine member spared more jail time after sentencing for historical crimes

image.altText: Sam Konstas and David Warner celebrate together

props.synopsis: David Warner was one of many onlookers impressed by Sam Konstas taking Jasprit Bumrah head on, and has questioned why some of his older, more experienced teammates did not do the same.

title.children: Warner calls for Konstas's teammates to be braver

image.altText: Stephen Fry wears a black tie at the 68th annual tony awards in 2014

props.synopsis: More than 1,200 people in politics, sport, the arts and community service are recognised on King Charles's New Year's Honours list.

title.children: Stephen Fry and UK Post Office scandal victims in king's honours list

image.altText: Fireworks in the night sky.

props.synopsis: Across the country, at the stroke of midnight, fireworks displays explode under the night sky to mark the beginning of a new year. But where does this tradition of celebrating New Year's Eve with fireworks come from?

title.children: Fireworks around the world mark New Year's Eve. But what started the tradition?

image.altText: A barista wiping down a coffee machine in a cafe

props.synopsis: Here's a quick look at some of the changes that come into effect when the clock ticks past midnight.

title.children: The laws that will come into effect when the clock strikes midnight

image.altText: A close up of a broken branch of a gumtree

props.synopsis: A man and woman have been rushed to hospital after a tree branch fell on them as they were walking down steps near Melbourne's Shrine of Remembrance.

title.children: Two people injured after tree branch falls near Shrine of Remembrance in Melbourne

image.altText: Luxury apartments line the shore of Grand Cayman island, a well known tax haven

props.synopsis: Australia now has among the strongest laws globally to fight tax avoidance. Every multinational operating locally must now publicly report to the ATO more detailed information about taxes paid, in an attempt to stamp out profit shifting into once notorious tax haven jurisdictions.

title.children: 'A huge win': New tax transparency laws aim to deter multinational tax avoidance

image.altText: Trump holds up a hair razor over the head of a man being held by two min in a wrestling ring

props.synopsis: The long hair and sparkly spandex of professional wrestling might seem a long way from the hallowed halls of the Capitol, but perhaps they have more in common than you'd think.

title.children: The WWE tactics Trump has been using to win over voters

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of the remnants of a burned home

props.synopsis: When a major blaze ran through the Grampians in 2006, Rod Marshall and his daughter Kim lost everything but their home. This time around, they weren't so lucky.

title.children: History repeats for Grampians farmers who have now lost home to bushfire

image.altText: Jimmy Carter, right, sits next to Deng Xiaoping.

props.synopsis: Former US president Jimmy Carter is remembered for his transformative role in Asia, including normalising relations with China more than four decades ago.

title.children: 'He was naive': The legacy of Jimmy Carter's breakthrough China policy

image.altText: woman with blue and purple hair with a black t-shirt, standing outside a cream brick house

props.synopsis: Real estate analysts say homebuyers are benefiting from a drop in house prices in regional Victoria, where Claire and her family have managed to become mortgage-free.

title.children: Claire is mortgage-free thanks to worst-performing property market

image.altText: Markers close off the highway with roadworks cars in the background

props.synopsis: Four people die in three separate car accidents on Western Australia's roads in a matter of hours, with a head-on crash claiming two lives in the South West.

title.children: Head-on highway collision kills two, with car travelling in wrong lanes

image.altText: Heavily armed police officers in black walk alongside black, armoured police vehicles via aerial view.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged following an attempted home invasion that triggered a police operation in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Gunman on run after shots fired at police during operation in Sydney

image.altText: The car on Geritz Rd in Kingaroy where a driver was rescued yesterday.

props.synopsis: Several people had to be rescued from floodwaters overnight after record rain fell on parts of Queensland.

title.children: Drivers and campers rescued as record rain hits Queensland

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles as he stands in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: It was a strong year for the ASX, which climbed to 24 new record highs on hopes of interest rate cuts. However, there is likely to be significant volatility in 2025 as investors try to work out the inflationary impacts of US president-elect Donald Trump's trade policies.

title.children: ASX investors may be underestimating Trump's trade wars

image.altText: An aerial shot shows a large building with composite columns surrounded by trees and other large buildings

props.synopsis: The revelation comes as US officials continue to grapple with the fallout of a massive Chinese cyber espionage campaign known as Salt Typhoon.

title.children: US Treasury says Chinese hackers led a 'major cybersecurity' breach

image.altText: Liam Payne leads into microphone

props.synopsis: Prosecutors in Argentina provide a lengthy update on their investigation into former One Direction singer Liam Payne's deadly balcony fall, as a judge alleges the pop star's friend Roger Nores is "criminally responsible".

title.children: Two more charged over death of former One Direction singer Liam Payne

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair and orange tinted glasses

props.synopsis: The court issues a written opinion upholding the $US5 million award that the Manhattan jury granted to E Jean Carroll for defamation and sexual abuse.

title.children: Appeals court upholds Trump sexual abuse finding in E Jean Carroll case

image.altText: A pink, orange and purple scarf and a label reading '100% polyester'.

props.synopsis: Synthetic textiles were once hailed as the future of fashion. Now, we all have to reckon with the consequences.

title.children: Most Australians don't know how polyester is made. Here's why that matters
